title: CMS Utilization Strategies for Remote Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Focuses on how pre-service teachers can design and operate science project-based lessons using a CMS (Content Management System).

learning_goals: Systematic design of science project-based learning activities is achievable through CMS functionality
Interaction strategies can be established by applying Chickering and Gamson’s Seven Principles of Good Practice to CMS tools
Achieves learner engagement rates exceeding 80% through modular content organization and restructuring
Science project implementation processes can be evaluated and feedback systems established based on CMS analytics data
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
